definition: to relent (to spare sb's feelings)/to show mercy or forgiveness/to forbear/lenient
to leave (a message etc)/to retain/to stay/to remain/to keep/to preserve
lit. start off leniently (idiom); please do not be too strict with me/Do not judge me too harshly./Look favorably on my humble efforts.

sentences.english: Bright spent unsparing hand, foot criticism of grass.
sentences.chinese: 手下留情花似锦，足下留情草如茵。

sentences.english: Bright spent unsparing hand, foot criticism of grass.
sentences.chinese: 手下留情花似锦，足下留情草如茵。

sentences.english: Because the before Feng returns to one service in the valley, he don't show leniency.
sentences.chinese: 因为之前峰回谷一役，他并没有手下留情。

sentences.english: He refused to hold her hand though she begged.
sentences.chinese: 尽管她苦苦哀求，他也没有手下留情。

sentences.english: Ask the hard questions to build and protect the company.
sentences.chinese: 在建设和保护公司方面提出不留情的问题。

sentences.english: When it was light enough Johnsy mercilessly commanded that the shade be raised.
sentences.chinese: 天刚亮，琼西毫不留情地命令把窗帘拉起来。

sentences.english: Digital designers will go so far as to unsympathetically say the same about analog-IC designers.
sentences.chinese: 数字设计师们也毫不留情地批评模拟集成电路设计师。

sentences.english: Forgiveness is the option of the strong.
sentences.chinese: 留情是强者才具有的品格。

sentences.english: Still favor this don't show consideration noodles as person?
A second student, called Zhao, was unsparing.
sentences.chinese: 另一个学生，姓赵，说得非常不留情面。

sentences.english: Unsentimentally, she threw out her dead son's toys.
sentences.chinese: 她毫不留情地把自己死去孩子的玩具全部扔掉了。

sentences.english: Such was the work to which Buddha gave himself with unsparing zeal for over forty years.
sentences.chinese: 这是工作的佛像了自己的不留情的热情超过四十年。

sentences.english: Bitch racoon dog is bitten again chase after again, ruthless.
sentences.chinese: 母狐貍就又咬又追，毫不留情。

sentences.english: Safety not to touch the red line, unsparing violation.
sentences.chinese: 安全红线不能碰，违章违纪不留情。

sentences.english: The online war over Gaza was relentless.
sentences.chinese: 整个加沙地带的网站战争同样毫不留情。

sentences.english: Last time he showed you no mercy.
sentences.chinese: 上次他对你丝毫不留情。

definition: lit. start off leniently (idiom); please do not be too strict with me/Do not judge me too harshly./Look favorably on my humble efforts.
to have tender, protective feelings for the fairer sex (idiom)
to kill to the last one (idiom)/to exterminate/to eradicate/ruthless
feelings and sensibilities/sentiment and face/sensitivity to other's feelings
to use violence (against sb)/to strong-arm sb/to manhandle
to push sb too far/to go too far (in oppressing people)
to leave room to maneuver/to leave a margin for error
unable to differentiate good from bad (idiom)/not to know what's good for one/unable to recognize others' good intentions
